description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ipvs","text":"The construction of coarse-grained systems from atomistic models is a key strategy in simulating molecular-level biological systems. This process involves reducing the complexity of an atomic system, represented by a large number of particles, to a coarser or simplified level, enabling the study of phenomena at larger time scales. To carry out this conversion, the tool insane.py can be employed, designed to generate topologies and initial configurations for coarse-grained systems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65g8n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b36k","text":"Firstly, insane.py is used to translate an atomistic model into a coarse-grained format, defining the relationship between groups of atoms and simplifying interactions. This step is essential to reduce computational load and enable simulations at extended time scales.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdbhf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnu7d","text":"Subsequently, GROMACS, a renowned molecular dynamics software suite, is utilized to perform molecular dynamics simulations on the newly generated coarse-grained system. This process allows for the study of the dynamics and behavior of the system under realistic conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r1fn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u8ah","text":"In the context of protein PEGylation, a common methodology to enhance protein stability and solubility, a basic approach is followed. PEGylation involves the covalent attachment of polyethylene glycol (PEG) to proteins, providing unique properties to improve drug efficacy and reduce immunogenicity. The basic methodology involves the appropriate selection of conjugation sites on the protein and the chemical binding of the PEG polymer, often through amide-type reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5uihh","text":"In summary, the construction of coarse-grained systems, the use of tools like insane.py, and the application of molecular dynamics techniques with GROMACS are pivotal in simulating molecular systems. Additionally, protein PEGylation offers an effective strategy to enhance various biomolecular properties with significant applications in drug development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7am4","text":"The field of improving proteins via PEGylation remains a vibrant area of research, yet a profound understanding of the interactions between polymers and proteins is still in its infancy. To shed light on these interactions and enable predictive insights, Molecular Dynamics (MD) simulations offer a powerful tool, particularly when focused on specific protein-polymer systems at the molecular level. In this protocol, we provide detailed instructions on simulating PEGylated proteins, leveraging the capabilities of the latest iteration of the Martini Coarse-Grained (CG) force field.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3c9g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q1ni","text":"The Martini CG force field is renowned for its ability to efficiently represent large biomolecular systems by grouping several atoms into a single interaction site. This coarse-grained approach significantly reduces computational demands while maintaining a remarkable level of accuracy. Specifically designed for simulating complex biological processes, the Martini force field captures the essential features of biomolecules, making it an ideal choice for studying intricate protein-polymer interactions.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsavp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek2cf","text":"This protocol focuses on the utilization of Martini CG force field in Molecular Dynamics simulations, providing researchers with the means to obtain nearly atomistic information. Unlike fully atomistic simulations, MD simulations with CG allow for the exploration of complex biological systems over extended temporal and spatial scales. This feature is particularly valuable when investigating the dynamic behavior of PEGylated proteins and their interactions with surrounding environments.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffgcm","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff9ij","text":"By presenting this protocol, we aim to empower researchers to delve deeper into the molecular dynamics of protein-PEG interactions, fostering a more comprehensive understanding of how PEGylation influences protein behavior at the molecular level. Through the integration of Martini CG force field in this protocol, we provide a sophisticated yet accessible approach to unraveling the complexities inherent in these biologically relevant systems.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fprc3","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beq9m","text":"MOLECULAR DYNAMICS GROMACS v2019 - SIMULATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vqdm","text":"General commands and usage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bq3j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ltpg","text":"GROMACS stands out as essential software for simulating molecular dynamics (MD) in coarse-grained structures, simplifying representations and enabling efficient large-scale studies. Its balanced approach between accuracy and computational efficiency makes it crucial in biomolecular research.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deur","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3l0n","text":"To run a molecular dynamics you need to execute 2 commands per phase. We understand that we will have x amount of phases as x amount of mdp files. Therefore, two commands per phase are required :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dspbv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4og51","text":"\u003cgrompp command\u003e","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mk6f","text":"The first, the grompp command, will load data from both the mdp, itp, system.gro, index.ndx and topol.top files.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u3jv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97a0m","text":"\u003cmdrun command\u003e","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tt36","text":"The second, mdrun command, executes the parameters loaded to Gromacs with the grompp command. In this command you specify how many cores to use, whether to use gpu and the name of the output files.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"446ut","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avc3o","text":"As an example, here is the command to run the energy minimization phase :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aft6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ajig","text":"Finally, to pass from the energy minimization stage to NVT equilibration, the files generated previously in the mdrun command (should be minimization.gro) must be used to generate the new NVT files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc9dk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4g892","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"E252781AB1CB11EE874C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"gmx grompp -f minimization.mdp -o minimization.tpr -c system.gro -r system.gro -p topol.top -n index.ndx -maxwarn 3\ngmx mdrun -deffnm minimization -v -nt 6","os_name":"","os_version":""}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"94B0090BB1CC11EE874C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"gmx grompp -f NVT-Equilibration.mdp -o NVT-Equilibration.tpr -c minimization.gro -r system.gro -p topol.top -n index.ndx -maxwarn 3\ngmx mdrun -deffnm NVT-Equilibration -v -nt 6 ","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekb60","text":"FILES MODIFICATION PRIOR MOLECULAR DYNAMICS :Input Parameters files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6os7e","text":"Input parameters explanation and modification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjd17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tgho","text":"Input files can be downloaded from Martini Coarse Grained official website -\u003e Martini Coarse Grained. You can modify some values depending in what do you want and your expertise in biophysics. .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":22}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1u7c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"316jf","text":"\u003cStandard Input Parameters File Attached in section 10\u003e ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1grhu","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0sbq","text":"Minimization Parameters:  The solvated, electroneutral system is now assembled. Before we can begin dynamics, we must ensure that the system has no steric clashes or inappropriate geometry. The structure is relaxed through a process called energy minimization (EM).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsnvn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q826","text":"Equilibration Parameters: Equilibration is often conducted in two phases, NVT and NPT phases. The first phase is conducted under an NVT ensemble (constant Number of particles, Volume, and Temperature). This ensemble is also referred to as \"isothermal-isochoric\" or \"canonical.\" And, equilibration of pressure is conducted under an NPT ensemble, wherein the Number of particles, Pressure, and Temperature are all constant. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26},{"style":"italic","offset":132,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":331,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6emm8","text":"In coarse grained system, its not need it an NVT equilibration, so just perform the quantity needed NPT equilibrations modificating Position restraints forces. For this tutorial we will use an approach in which we will increase the time in the \"dt\" option from 1 to 15 femtoseconds, increasing 5 femtoseconds for each mdp balance file, so 4 NPT equilibration processes will be performed.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":100,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pck3","text":"In addition to the above, the positional constraint values will gradually decrease from 1000 to 125 kJ/mol nm2, decreasing by half to 125 kJ/mol nm2.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":109,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":147,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f9uk","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86fv6","text":"Production Parameters: Upon completion of the two equilibration phases, the system is now well-equilibrated at the desired temperature and pressure. We are now ready to release the position restraints and run production MD for data collection. The process is just like we have seen before, as we will make use of the checkpoint file (which in this case now contains preserve pressure coupling information) to grompp. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jdvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dll8","text":"Almost every parameter in mdp file can be modified. If you download mdp files from martini website, unless you really know what to change in this parameters, as an advice \"don't change the parameters\". These defaults parameters are already tested. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":172,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89r5s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7B70881A81004F5FA6BC45268B5FFFC4","url":"http://www.cgmartini.nl/index.php/force-field-parameters/input-parameters"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ss2p","text":"MARTINI STRUCTURE CONVERSION","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s1pl","text":"From all atom to coarse grained. {"blocks":[{"key":"bjhm2","text":"MOLECULAR DYNAMICS GROMACS v2019 - GENERAL ANALYSIS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8aopk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afc7p","text":"The analysis of molecular dynamics (MD) simulations in GROMACS is crucial for understanding atomic-level interactions in biomolecular structures. GROMACS provides detailed trajectories, and the analysis reveals valuable insights into dynamics and stability. Aspects such as conformational variability and binding site identification are explored, contributing to the understanding of biological processes. Advanced analytical techniques allow for precise examination of energetics.
